intro: Argythamnia mercurialina, commonly known as the mercury thistle, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its spiny, lobed leaves and yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. It produces small, hairy seeds that are dispersed by the wind. Due to its ecological importance and ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
